Comment: I think one silver lining is this has driven me to look at alternative products that didn't have the same brand name pull. I've actually found really good alternatives, like Utz for chips (though even they are getting a bit expensive for my liking), or Saladitas for saltine crackers instead of Nabisco Premium.  You can get better quality at lower prices if you're willing to try different brands out that don't have the brand name premium attached to them. It does sometimes mean you end up with an inferior product, but you only have to make that mistake once or twice before you can find solid alternatives.
Author: Orzorn

Author: Comprehensive_Main

Comment: Oh yeah. Manager at a grocery store. Chips are 6.99, big brand soda is 9.99 a 12 pack and 2.99 a 2 liter. Cookies have gone up, dishwasher pods are reducing quantity by 4 while maintaining the same price point, and other profucts are spiking price all over the place.    Just looking at soda, we barely move units at buy 2, get 1 free, then can't keep the shelves stocked at buy 2, get 3 free. Soda may be a frivolous purchase, but people are very much holding back buying until the big sales.    Hell, this is the first year I can remember where we still had mountains of egg coloring kit stock on Easter. Usually we're wiped out a week or two before the holiday.   Pricing is wild out there right now, and it's not getting any better in the foreseeable future.
Author: reflecttcelfer
